text: The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel;
speaker: Narrator

text: to know wisdom and chastening; to understand prudent words;
speaker: Narrator

text: to receive the chastening of prudence, justice, judgment, and equity;
speaker: Narrator

text: to give prudence to the simple, and to the young men knowledge and council.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the wise will hear them, doctrine shall increase, and the man of understanding shall acquire wise counsel:
speaker: Narrator

text: To understand a parable and the interpretation; the words of the wise and their enigmas.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and chastening.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, hearken unto the chastening of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother:
speaker: Narrator

text: For they shall be an increase of grace unto thy head and protection about thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, if sinners entice thee, do not consent.
speaker: Narrator

text: If they say, Come with us, let us lay in wait for blood; let us ambush the innocent without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us swallow them up alive as Sheol and whole as those that go down into the pit;
speaker: Narrator

text: We shall find all kinds of riches, we shall fill our houses with spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast in thy lot among us; let us all have one purse:
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, do not walk in the way with them; refrain thy foot from their path:
speaker: Narrator

text: For their feet shall run to evil and make haste to shed blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely in vain the net is spread in the sight of any bird.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they lay in wait for their own blood; they ambush their own souls.
speaker: Narrator

text: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain which takes away the life of those who possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom cries without; she utters her voice in the streets:
speaker: Narrator

text: She cries in the chief place of concourse, in the entrance to the gates of the city she utters her words, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorners delight in their scorning, and the fools hate knowledge?
speaker: Narrator

text: Return at my reproof; behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because I have called and ye refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no one responded;
speaker: Narrator

text: for because ye have disregarded all my counsel and rejected my reproof:
speaker: Narrator

text: I also will laugh at your calamity; I will mock when your fear comes upon you;
speaker: Narrator

text: when what you have feared comes as destruction, and your calamity comes as a whirlwind; when tribulation and anguish come upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they shall call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall seek me early, but they shall not find me:
speaker: Narrator

text: Because they hated knowledge and did not choose the fear of the LORD:
speaker: Narrator

text: They rejected my counsel: they despised all my reproof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they shall eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own counsel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the rest of the ignorant shall slay them, and the prosperity of fools shall destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whosoever hearkens unto me shall dwell safely and shall rest from the fear of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words and hide my commandments within thee
speaker: Narrator

text: so that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom and apply thine heart to intelligence,
speaker: Narrator

text: yea, if thou criest for understanding and givest thy voice unto intelligence,
speaker: Narrator

text: if thou seekest her as silver and searchest for her as for hid treasures,
speaker: Narrator

text: then shalt thou understand the fear of the LORD and find the knowledge of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD gives wisdom; out of his mouth comes knowledge and intelligence.
speaker: Narrator

text: He keeps the person of the upright; he is a buckler to those that walk perfectly,
speaker: Narrator

text: keeping the paths of judgment and the way of his merciful ones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou understand righteousness and judgment and equity, yea, every good path.
speaker: Narrator

text: When wisdom enters into thine heart and knowledge is sweet unto thy soul,
speaker: Narrator

text: discretion shall preserve thee, intelligence shall keep thee
speaker: Narrator

text: to deliver thee from the evil way, from the man that speaks perversion,
speaker: Narrator

text: who leave the paths of uprightness to walk in the ways of darkness,
speaker: Narrator

text: who rejoice to do evil and delight in wicked perversion,
speaker: Narrator

text: whose ways are crooked, and they are crooked in their paths;
speaker: Narrator

text: to deliver thee from the strange woman, even from the stranger who flatters with her words,
speaker: Narrator

text: who forsakes the prince of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore her house inclines unto death, and her paths unto the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: None that go unto her return again, neither do they take hold of the paths of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thou may walk in the way of good men and keep the paths of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, and the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, forget not my law, but let thine heart keep my commandments:
speaker: Narrator

text: For they shall add length of days and long life and peace unto thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee; bind them about thy neck; write them upon the tablet of thine heart:
speaker: Narrator

text: So shalt thou find grace and good favour in the sight of God and man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart and lean not unto thine own understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear the LORD and depart from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be medicine to thy navel and marrow to thy bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honour the LORD with thy substance and with the firstfruits of all thine increase:
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty, and thy presses shall burst out with new wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, do not despise the chastening of the LORD; neither be weary of his correction:
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD chastens whom he loves and delights in, even as a father to his son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man that has found wisdom and who brings to light intelligence,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver and the fruits thereof more than fine gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: She is more precious than precious stones, and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Length of days is in her right hand and in her left hand riches and honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: She is a tree of life to those that lay hold upon her, and blessed is every one that retains her.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD by wisdom has founded the earth; by intelligence has he established the heavens.
speaker: Narrator

text: By his knowledge the depths are broken up, and the heavens drop down the dew.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, do not let them depart from thine eyes; keep sound wisdom and discretion,
speaker: Narrator

text: so shall they be life unto thy soul and grace to thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt lie down, and thy sleep shall be sweet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shall not be afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked when it comes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD shall be thy confidence and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not say unto thy neighbour, Go and come again and tomorrow I will give when thou hast it by thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not devise evil against thy neighbour, seeing he dwells securely by thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not sue a man without cause, if he has done thee no harm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Envy thou not the oppressor and choose none of his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the perverse is an abomination to the LORD; but his secret is with the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The curse of the LORD is in the house of the wicked, but he shall bless the habitation of the just.
speaker: Narrator

text: Surely he scorns the scorners; but he gives grace unto the humble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise shall inherit glory; but shame shall be the promotion of fools.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken, ye sons, unto the chastening of the father, and pay attention that ye might know understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I give you good doctrine; do not forsake my law.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I was my father’s son, tender and unique in the sight of my mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: He taught me and said unto me, Sustain thine heart with my words; keep my commandments, and live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get wisdom, get understanding; forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forsake her not, and she shall preserve thee; love her, and she shall keep thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom is the principal thing, therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: Grow in wisdom, and she shall promote thee; she shall bring thee to honour when thou hast embraced her.
speaker: Narrator

text: She shall give to thine head an increase of grace; a crown of glory shall she deliver to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, O my son, and receive my words, and the years of thy life shall be multiplied.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have caused thee to walk in right paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou goest in these paths, thy steps shall not be hindered; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take fast hold of chastening; do not let go; keep this; for it is thy life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they do not sleep, unless they have done evil; and their sleep is taken away, unless they cause someone to fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the path of the just is as the light of the morning star, that shines more and more until the day is perfect.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the wicked is as darkness; they do not know in what they stumble.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they are life unto those that find them and medicine to all their flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above all else, guard thy heart; for out of it flows the issues of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put away from thee the perversion of the mouth, and the deviation of the lips put far from thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thine eyes look upon that which is right, and let thine eyelids straighten thy path before thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be established.
speaker: Narrator

text: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left; remove thy foot from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my intelligence;
speaker: Narrator

text: that thou may keep council and that thy lips may conserve knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the lips of the strange woman drop as a honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil,
speaker: Narrator

text: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her feet go down to death, her steps uphold Sheol,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest thou should ponder the path of life, her ways are unstable; thou shalt not know them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear me now therefore, O ye sons, and do not depart from the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove thy way far from her, and do not come near the door of her house,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest thou give thine honour unto others and thy years unto the cruel,
speaker: Narrator

text: lest strangers be filled with thy wealth, and thy labours be in the house of a stranger,
speaker: Narrator

text: and thou mourn at the last when thy flesh and thy body are consumed
speaker: Narrator

text: and say, How have I hated chastening and my heart despised reproof
speaker: Narrator

text: and have not obeyed the voice of those who chastened me, nor inclined my ear to those that instructed me!
speaker: Narrator

text: I have been in almost every kind of evil, in the midst of society and of the congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Drink waters out of thine own cistern and running waters out of thine own well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of thy waters in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let them be only thine own and not for strangers with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy fountain shall be blessed; and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love, without eyes for anyone else.
speaker: Narrator

text: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a woman belonging to someone else, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he weighs all his goings.
speaker: Narrator

text: His own iniquities shall take hold of the wicked, and he shall be imprisoned with the cords of his sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall die because he did not submit to chastening; and due to the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,
speaker: Narrator

text: thou art snared with the words of thy mouth; thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, for thou hast fallen into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.
speaker: Narrator

text: Escape as a roe from the hand of the hunter and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise,
speaker: Narrator

text: Who having no guide, overseer, or ruler,
speaker: Narrator

text: provides her food in the summer and gathers her food in the harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall thy poverty come as one that travels and thy want as an armed man.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wicked man of Belial walks with a perverse mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: He winks with his eyes, he speaks with his feet, he teaches with his fingers;
speaker: Narrator

text: there is perversion in his heart; he devises evil continually; he sows discord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore his calamity shall come suddenly; suddenly he shall be broken without remedy.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six things does the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:
speaker: Narrator

text: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,
speaker: Narrator

text: a heart that devises wicked imaginations, feet that are swift in running to evil,
speaker: Narrator

text: a false witness that speaks lies, and he that sows discord among brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, keep thy father’s commandment and forsake not the law of thy mother:
speaker: Narrator

text: Bind them continually upon thine heart and tie them about thy neck.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the commandment is fire, and the law is light; and reproofs of chastening are the way of life,
speaker: Narrator

text: to keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart, neither let her take thee with her eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by means of a whorish woman a man is reduced to a piece of bread, and the woman will hunt the precious soul of the man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Can a man take fire in his bosom and his clothes not be burned?
speaker: Narrator

text: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?
speaker: Narrator

text: So is he that goes in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever touches her shall not be innocent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Men do not take a thief lightly, even if he steals to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;
speaker: Narrator

text: and once he is taken, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: But whosoever commits adultery with a woman has a fault in his heart; he that does it corrupts his own soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wound and dishonour shall he get, and his reproach shall never be wiped away.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the jealous rage of a man will not spare in the day of vengeance.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he want to forgive, though thou givest many bribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, keep my words, and lay up my commandments with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bind them upon thy fingers; write them upon the tablet of thine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister, and call understanding thy kinswoman:
speaker: Narrator

text: That they may keep thee from the woman belonging to someone else, from the stranger who flatters with her words.
speaker: Narrator

text: For at the window of my house I looked through my casement
speaker: Narrator

text: and beheld among the simple ones, I discerned among the youths, a young man void of understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text: passing through the street near her corner; and he went the way to her house,
speaker: Narrator

text: in the twilight, in the evening, in the black and dark night;
speaker: Narrator

text: and, behold, a woman met him with the attire of a harlot, and subtil of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: (She is loud and stubborn; her feet do not abide in her house:
speaker: Narrator

text: Now without, now in the streets, she lies in wait at every corner.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So she caught him and kissed him and with an impudent face said unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: I had promised sacrifices of peace; today I have paid my vows.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I came forth to meet thee, diligently to seek thy face, and I have found thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry, with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning; let us solace ourselves with loves.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the husband is not at home; he is gone a long journey:
speaker: Narrator

text: He has taken a bag of money with him and will come home at the appointed feast day.
speaker: Narrator

text: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield; with the flattering of her lips she persuaded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went after her straightway, as an ox goes to the slaughter or as a fool to the correction of the stocks,
speaker: Narrator

text: until the arrow pierces through his liver. He is as a bird struggling in the snare and not knowing that it is against his own life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye sons, and attend to the words of my mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not thine heart decline to her ways; do not go astray in her paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: For she has caused many to fall down dead; yea, all the strong men have been slain by her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her house is the way to Sheol, going down to the chambers of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Doth not wisdom cry, and give her voice to intelligence?
speaker: Narrator

text: She stands in the top of high places, by the way at the crossroads of the paths.
speaker: Narrator

text: She cries at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: O ye simple, understand prudence; and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear, for I will speak of excellent things, and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
speaker: Narrator

text: For my mouth shall speak truth, and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing perverse or twisted in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are all plain to him that understands and right to those that have found wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Receive my chastening and not silver, and knowledge rather than choice gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: For wisdom is better than precious stones; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, wisdom, dwell with prudence, and I invent the knowledge of giving counsel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil; pride, arrogancy, the evil way, and the perverse mouth, do I hate.
speaker: Narrator

text: With me is counsel, and existence; I am understanding; strength belongs to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: By me the kings reign, and the princes decree justice.
speaker: Narrator

text: By me the princes rule, and all of the governors judge the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I love those that love me, and those that seek me early shall find me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Riches and honour are with me, yea, durable riches and righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than precious stones, and my revenue than choice silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: I shall lead in the way of righteousness in the midst of the paths of judgment,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I may cause my friends to inherit existence and I will fill their treasures.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was set up with eternal dominion, from the beginning, before the earth was.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was begotten before the depths, before the existence of the fountains of many waters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before the mountains were founded, before the hills was I begotten.
speaker: Narrator

text: While as yet he had not made the earth nor the fields nor the beginning of the dust of the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: when he composed the heavens, I was there. When he set a compass upon the face of the depth,
speaker: Narrator

text: when he established the clouds above, when he strengthened the fountains of the deep,
speaker: Narrator

text: when he gave to the sea his decree that the waters should not pass his commandment, when he appointed the foundations of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text: I was with him ordering everything; I was his delight every day, being content before him at all times;
speaker: Narrator

text: I am content in the circumference of his earth, and my contentment is with the sons of men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye sons; for blessed are those that keep my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto chastening, and be wise; refuse it not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessed is the man that hears me, keeping vigil at my gates, waiting at the threshold of my doors.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whosoever finds me shall find life and shall obtain the will of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he that sins against me wrongs his own soul; all those that hate me love death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom has built her house; she has hewn out her seven pillars:
speaker: Narrator

text: She has killed her sacrifice; she has mingled her wine; and she has furnished her table.
speaker: Narrator

text: She has sent forth her maidens; she cries upon the highest places of the city,
speaker: Narrator

text: whosoever is simple, let him turn in here; as for those that lack understanding, {Heb. lacking of heart} she saith unto him,
speaker: Narrator

text: Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forsake that which is foolish and live and go in the way of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that chastens a scorner brings shame unto himself, and he that chastens a wicked man brings himself a blot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chasten not a scorner lest he hate thee; chasten a wise man, and he will love thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser; teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself; but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.
speaker: Narrator

text: A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple and knows nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: For she sits at the door of her house on a seat in the high places of the city
speaker: Narrator

text: to call to those who pass by the way, to those who straighten their ways;
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever is simple, let him turn in here; and as for him that lacks understanding, she saith unto him:
speaker: Narrator

text: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he does not know that the dead are there and that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wise son makes a glad father; but a foolish son is sadness unto his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing, but righteousness delivers from death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish, but wickedness shall cast out the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that deals with a slack hand becomes poor, but the hand of the diligent makes rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that gathers in summer is a wise son, but he that sleeps in harvest is a son that causes shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Blessings are upon the head of the just, but the mouth of the wicked covers violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: The memory of the just is blessed, but the name of the wicked shall stink.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise in heart will receive the commandments, but he who speaks foolishness shall fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that walks in integrity walks securely, but he that perverts his ways shall be broken.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that winks with the eye causes sorrow, and he that speaks foolishness shall fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life, but the mouth of the wicked covers violence.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hatred stirs up strifes, but love covers all sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the lips of the prudent wisdom is found and is a rod unto the back of him that is void of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wise men keep knowledge, but the mouth of the foolish is near unto calamity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city; the weakness of the poor is their poverty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The work of the righteous is unto life, but the fruit of the wicked is for sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is in the way of life that gives heed to chastening, but he that refuses reproof errs.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that hides hatred has lying lips, and he that utters a slander, is a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the multitude of words there is no lack of rebellion, but he that refrains his lips is wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tongue of the just is as choice silver, but the understanding {Heb. heart} of the wicked is worth little.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lips of the righteous feed many, but fools die for lack of wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: The blessing of the LORD is that which makes rich, and he adds no sorrow with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: To make an abomination is as sport to the fool, but wisdom is recreation to the man of intelligence.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him, but God shall grant the desire of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the whirlwind passes, the wicked is no more, but the righteous is founded for ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: As vinegar to the teeth and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to those that send him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the LORD shall prolong days, but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hope of the righteous is joy, but the hope of the wicked shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the LORD is strength to the perfect, but it is terror to the workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous eternally shall never be removed, but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of the just shall bring forth wisdom, but the perverse tongue shall be cut out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lips of the righteous shall know the will of God, but the mouth of the wicked speaks perversion.
speaker: Narrator

text: A false balance is abomination to the LORD, but a just weight is his delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: When pride comes, then comes shame, but with the humble is wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: The perfection of the upright shall guide them in the way, but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Riches shall not profit in the day of wrath, but righteousness shall deliver from death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteousness of the perfect shall straighten his way, but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them, but transgressors shall be imprisoned in their own sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wicked man dies, his hope perishes, and the hope of unjust men shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous is delivered out of the tribulation, and the wicked takes his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbour, but the just are delivered with wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices, and when the wicked perish, there are feasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted, but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is void of understanding despises his neighbour, but the intelligent man remains silent.
speaker: Narrator

text: A talebearer reveals secrets, but he that is of a faithful spirit conceals the matter.
speaker: Narrator

text: When intelligence is lacking, the people shall fall, but in the multitude of counsellors there is salvation.
speaker: Narrator

text: With anxiety shall he that is surety for a stranger be afflicted, and he that hates suretiship shall live securely.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gracious woman retains honour, and strong men retain riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: The merciful man does good to his own soul, but the cruel man troubles his own flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked works a deceitful work, but to him that sows righteousness shall be a sure reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: As righteousness is unto life, so he that pursues evil pursues it unto his own death.
speaker: Narrator

text: They that are of a perverse heart are an abomination to the LORD, but such as are perfect in their way are his delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: No matter how many covenants he has made with death, the wicked shall not be absolved, but the seed of the righteous shall escape.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a gold ring in a swine’s snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desire of the righteous is only good, but the hope of the wicked is wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are those who scatter, and more is added unto them; and there are those who withhold more than is just, but come to poverty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soul who is a blessing unto others shall be made fat, and he that fills shall be filled also himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that withholds the grain, the people shall curse him, but blessing shall be upon the head of him that sells it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that seeks good early shall find favour, but unto him that seeks evil, it shall come upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that trusts in his riches shall fall, but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that troubles his own house shall inherit the wind, and the fool shall be slave to the wise of heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he that wins souls is wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous shall certainly be recompensed in the earth; how much more the wicked and the sinner!
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever loves chastening loves knowledge, but he that hates reproof is carnal.
speaker: Narrator

text: The good man shall attain the favour of the LORD, but the man of wicked thoughts he will condemn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man shall not be established by wickedness, but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: The virtuous woman is a crown to her husband, but she that makes ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: The thoughts of the righteous are upright, but the astuteness of the wicked is deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood, but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
speaker: Narrator

text: God shall overthrow the wicked, and they shall not be any longer, but the house of the righteous shall remain.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom, but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that despises himself and becomes a slave is better than he that honours himself and lacks bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous is merciful even unto his beast, but the piety of the wicked is cruel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that tills his land shall be satisfied with bread, but he that follows vain persons is void of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked desires the net of evil men, but the root of the righteous shall yield fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips, but the just shall come out of the tribulation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth, and the recompense of a man’s hands shall be rendered unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the fool is right in his own eyes, but he that hears counsel is wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fool’s wrath is presently known, but he who covers the injury is sane.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that speaks truth shows forth righteousness, but a false witness, deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are those that speak like the piercings of a sword, but the tongue of the wise is medicine.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lip of truth shall be established for ever, but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deceit is in the heart of those whose thoughts are evil, but joy in that of those whose thoughts are good.
speaker: Narrator

text: No iniquity shall overtake the righteous: but the wicked shall be filled with evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lying lips are abomination to the LORD: but the workers of the truth are his delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sane man conceals his wisdom: but the heart of fools proclaims foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the negligent shall be under tribute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heaviness in the heart of man makes it stoop: but a good word makes it glad.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous causes his neighbour to consider: but the way of the wicked causes them to err.
speaker: Narrator

text: The deceitful man does not even roast that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the way of righteousness is life; and in the pathway thereof there is no death.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wise son takes his father’s chastening: but a scorner does not hear rebuke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the fruit of his mouth man shall eat well: but the soul of the transgressors shall starve.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that keeps his mouth keeps his life: but he that opens his lips often shall have calamity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soul of the sluggard desires, and attains nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous man hates lying: but the wicked man makes himself loathsome, and abominable.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteousness keeps the one of the perfect way: but wickedness overthrows the sinner.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are those that make themselves rich, yet have nothing: there are those that make themselves poor, yet have great riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: The redemption of a man’s life is his riches: but the poor does not hear rebuke.
speaker: Narrator

text: The light of the righteous shall rejoice: but the fire of the wicked shall be put out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pride shall certainly give birth to contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: The riches of vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathers by labour shall increase.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hope deferred makes the heart sick: but when the desire is fulfilled, it is a tree of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever despises the word shall perish by it: but he that fears the commandment shall be rewarded.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good understanding brings forth grace: but the way of transgressors is hard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every sane man works according to wisdom: but the fool shall manifest his folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: A bad messenger shall fall into evil: but a faithful ambassador is medicine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuses chastening: but he that regards reproof shall be honoured.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that walks with wise men shall be wise, but the companion of fools shall be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Evil pursues sinners, but to the righteous good shall be repaid.
speaker: Narrator

text: A good man shall leave an inheritance to his children’s children, and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the fallow ground of the poor there is much bread, but it is lost for lack of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that cuts short chastening hates his son, but he that loves him chastens him early.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous eats until his soul is satisfied, but the belly of the wicked shall lack.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every wise woman builds her house, but the foolish plucks it down with her hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that walks in his uprightness fears the LORD, but he that is perverse in his ways despises him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride, but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Without oxen, the storehouse is clean, but by the strength of the ox there is abundance of bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: The true witness will not lie, but the false witness will utter lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: The scorner sought wisdom and found it not, but wisdom comes easy unto him that understands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go from the presence of the foolish man when thou dost not perceive in him the lips of knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wisdom of the sane is to understand his way, but the folly of fools is deceit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fools speak sin unto themselves, but among the righteous there is love.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart knows the bitterness of his soul, and a stranger shall not intermeddle with his joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The house of the wicked shall be made desolate, but the tent of the upright shall flourish.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a way which seems right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even in laughter, the scorner has pain in his heart, and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways, and the good man shall be separated from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The simple believes every word, but the prudent man understands his steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise man fears and departs from evil, but the fool rages and is confident.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is soon angry shall deal foolishly, and the man of wicked devices shall be hated.
speaker: Narrator

text: The simple shall inherit folly, but the prudent shall be crowned with wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who are evil shall bow before those who are good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour, but many are those who love the rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sinner despises his neighbour, but he that has mercy on the poor is blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do they not err that meditate upon evil? but those that meditate upon good shall attain mercy and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: In all labour there is fruit, but to talk and not do, brings poverty.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crown of the wise is their wisdom, but that which distinguishes fools is their folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The true witness delivers souls, but the deceitful one speaks lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence, and there his sons shall have hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the multitude of the people is the king’s glory, but in the failure of the people is the weakness of the prince.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is slow to wrath is of great intelligence, but he that is short of spirit exalts folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: A sound heart is life to the flesh, but envy is rottenness of the bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that oppresses the poor reproaches his Maker, but he that has mercy on the poor, honours him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For his wickedness shall the wicked be cast out, but the righteous in his death has hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom shall rest in the heart of him that is sane and is made known in the midst of the fools.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteousness exalts a people, but sin is a reproach to the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king’s favour is toward the wise slave, but his wrath is against him that causes shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: A soft answer turns away wrath, but grievous words stir up anger.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tongue of the wise shall adorn wisdom, but the mouth of fools shall speak foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of the LORD are in every place, beholding those who are evil and those who are good.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wholesome tongue is a tree of life, but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fool despises his father’s chastening, but he that regards reproof shall become prudent.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the house of the righteous is much provision, but in the fruit of the wicked is trouble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lips of the wise disperse wisdom, but the heart of the foolish does not so.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD, but the prayer of the upright is his delight.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the LORD, but he loves him that follows after righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chastening is grievous unto him that forsakes the way, but he that hates reproof shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sheol and hell are before the LORD; how much more then the hearts of men?
speaker: Narrator

text: The scorner does not love the one that reproves him, neither will he go unto the wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: A joyful heart makes a beautiful countenance, but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is abated.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of him that has understanding seeks wisdom, but the mouth of fools feeds on foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the days of the poor are difficult, but he that is of a good heart has a continual feast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better is little with the fear of the LORD than great treasure and trouble therewith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better is a dinner of vegetables where love is than a fatted calf and hatred therewith.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wrathful man stirs up strife, but he that is slow to anger appeases strife.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the slothful man is as a hedge of thorns, but the path of the righteous is made plain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise son makes a glad father, but the foolish man despises his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Folly is joy to him that is destitute of understanding, but the man who is intelligent walks uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Without counsel purposes are disappointed, but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man has joy by the answer of his mouth, and a word spoken in due season, how good it is!
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of life is uphill to the wise, that he may separate himself from Sheol below.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD will destroy the house of the proud, but he will establish the inheritance of the widow.
speaker: Narrator

text: The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD, but the speech of the pure is pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is greedy of gain troubles his own house, but he that hates gifts shall live.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of the righteous studies to answer, but the mouth of the wicked pours out evil things.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD is far from the wicked, but he hears the prayer of the righteous.
speaker: Narrator

text: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart, and a good report makes the bones fat.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ear that hears the reproof of life shall abide among the wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that refuses chastening despises his own soul, but he that hears reproof has an understanding heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom, and before honour is humility.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of man are the preparations of the heart, but the answer of the tongue is from the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes, but the LORD weighs the spirits.
speaker: Narrator

text: Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
speaker: Narrator

text: The LORD has made all things by himself, yea, even the wicked for the day of evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD; the covenant that he makes, shall not be without chastening.
speaker: Narrator

text: By mercy and truth iniquity is purged, and by the fear of the LORD men depart from evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man’s ways please the LORD, he makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better is a little with righteousness than a great number of fruits with injustice.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of man devises his way, but the LORD directs his steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king; his mouth does not transgress in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: A just weight and balance are the LORD’s; all the weights of the bag are his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness, for the throne is to be established with righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Righteous lips are the delight of kings, and they love him that speaks that which is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wrath of the king is as a messenger of death, but the wise man will avoid it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the light of the king’s countenance is life, and his favour is as a cloud of the latter rain.
speaker: Narrator

text: How much better is it to acquire wisdom than gold! and to acquire understanding is worth more than silver!
speaker: Narrator

text: The highway of the upright is to separate himself from evil; he that keeps his way preserves his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pride goes before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to humble your spirit with the lowly than to divide the spoil with the proud.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who has understanding in the word shall find good, and blessed is he who trusts in the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise in heart is called a man of understanding; and the sweetness of the lips shall increase doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Understanding is a wellspring of life unto him that has it, but the instruction of fools is folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of the wise causes his mouth to be prudent, and with his lips he shall increase doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pleasant words are as a honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and medicine to the bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is a way that seems right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soul of him that labours, labours for himself; for his mouth craves it of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man of Belial digs in search of evil, and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: The perverse man sows strife, and the tale bearer separates princes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The evil man flatters his neighbour and leads him into the way that is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shuts his eyes to devise perverse things; moving his lips he brings evil to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Old age is a crown of glory if it is found in the way of righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty, and he that rules his spirit than he that takes a city.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lot is cast into the lap, but the judgment thereof is of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better is a dry morsel in peace than the house of contention full of sacrifices for a feast.
speaker: Narrator

text: A prudent slave shall have rule over a son that causes shame and shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold, but the LORD tries the hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: An evil doer gives heed to false lips, and a liar gives ear to the tongue which curses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever mocks the poor reproaches his Maker, and he that is glad regarding the calamity of someone else shall not go unpunished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Children’s children are the crown of old men, and the honour of the children are their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Excellent speech is not suitable for a fool: much less lying lips for a prince!
speaker: Narrator

text: A bribe is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that has it; wherever it turns, it prospers.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that covers a transgression seeks love, but he that repeats a matter separates very friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reproof is of more benefit to a wise man than a hundred stripes to a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rebellious man seeks only evil; therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to meet a bear robbed of her cubs than a fool in his folly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever rewards evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: To release the waters (to speak rashly) is the beginning of contention; therefore, leave off strife before it gets started.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that justifies the wicked and he that condemns the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of what good is the price to buy wisdom in the hand of the fool, seeing he has no heart to understand?
speaker: Narrator

text: A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man void of understanding strikes hands and becomes surety in the presence of his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: Transgression loves him that loves strife, and he that exalts his gate seeks destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that has a perverse heart shall never find good, and he that stirs up trouble with his tongue shall fall into evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that begets a fool does it to his sorrow, and the father of a fool shall have no joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: A joyful heart shall do good like a medicine, but a broken spirit dries the bones.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wicked man takes a gift in secret to pervert the paths of judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom appears upon the countenance of him that has understanding, but the eyes of a fool manifest his folly unto the ends of the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foolish son is a grief to his father and bitterness to her that bore him.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is certainly not good to condemn the just, nor to smite princes for doing that which is upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who has knowledge spares his words, and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even a fool, when he is silent is counted wise, and he that shuts his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever goes astray seeks according to his own lust and shall meddle with every doctrine.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fool has no delight in understanding, but in that which his own heart discovers.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wicked comes, then comes also contempt, and with him who dishonours, reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
speaker: Narrator

text: To respect the person of the wicked so that the righteous loses that which is rightfully his is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fool’s lips enter into contention, and his mouth calls for strokes.
speaker: Narrator

text: A fool’s mouth is his destruction, and his lips are the snare of his soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: The words of a talebearer seem smooth, but they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also that is negligent in his work is brother to him that is the great spendthrift.
speaker: Narrator

text: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous shall run into it, and be raised up.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city and as a high wall in his imagination.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before being broken, the heart of man is haughty, and before coming into honour, comes being brought to humility.
speaker: Narrator

text: For him that answers a word before he hears, it is folly and reproach unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The spirit of man will bear his infirmity, but a broken spirit who can bear?
speaker: Narrator

text: The heart of the man of understanding acquires wisdom, and the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man’s gift makes room for him and brings him before great men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who is just is first in his cause, his adversary comes and seeks him out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lot causes contentions to cease and decides between the mighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city, and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man’s belly shall be filled with the fruit of his mouth, and with the product of his lips shall he be filled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Death and life are in the power of the tongue, and those that love it shall eat its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever found a wife found a good thing and has attained the favour of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The poor uses intreaties, but the rich answer roughly.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man that has friends must show himself to be a friend, and there is a friend that sticks closer than a brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Better is the poor that walks in his integrity than he that is perverse in his lips and is a fool.
speaker: Narrator

text: That the soul be without wisdom is not good, and he that hastens with his feet sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foolishness of man perverts his way, and his heart is wroth against the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wealth makes many friends, but the poor is separated from his neighbour.
speaker: Narrator

text: A false witness shall not go unpunished, and he that speaks lies shall not escape.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many will intreat the favour of the prince, but every man is a friend to him that gives.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the brethren of the poor hate him; how much more shall his friends separate themselves from him? He shall seek their friendship and not find it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that gets wisdom loves his own soul; he keeps intelligence that he might find that which is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: The false witness shall not go unpunished, and he that speaks lies shall perish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Delight is not suitable for a fool; much less for a slave to have rule over princes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The discretion of a man defers his anger, and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion, but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: A foolish son is a pain unto his father, and the contentions of a wife are a continual dripping.
speaker: Narrator

text: House and riches are the inheritance from fathers, but the prudent wife is from the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep, and the negligent soul shall suffer hunger.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that keeps the commandment keeps his own soul, but he that despises his ways shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that gives unto the poor lends unto the LORD, and he will give him his reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Chasten thy son while there is hope, but do not stir up thy soul to destroy him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man of great wrath shall suffer the consequences, for even if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear counsel, and receive chastening that thou may be wise in thy old age.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are many thoughts in the heart of man; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD shall stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Contentment is unto men to show mercy, but it is better to do it unto the poor than to the liar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the LORD is unto life, and he that has it shall live satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slothful man hides his hand in his bosom and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Smite a scorner, and the simple will become prudent, and reproving one that has understanding, he will understand knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that steals from his father and chases away his mother is a son that causes shame and brings reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cease, my son, to hear the teaching that induces one to deviate from the reasons of wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: A witness of Belial shall scorn judgment, and the mouth of the wicked shall cover iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judgments are prepared for scorners and stripes for the back of fools.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wine makes a mocker, and beer a reveler, and whoever errs concerning them shall never be wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fear of the king is as the roaring of a lion; whoever provokes him to anger sins against his own soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife, but every fool will be meddling.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefore he shall beg in harvest and have nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water, but a man of intelligence will draw it out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Most men will proclaim each one his own mercy, but who can find a man of truth?
speaker: Narrator

text: The just man who walks in his integrity, blessed shall be his sons after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A king that sits in the throne of judgment scatters away all evil with his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who shall be able to say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
speaker: Narrator

text: Double weights and double measures, both of them are alike abomination to the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work is pure and whether it is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hearing ear and the seeing eye, the LORD has made both of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not love sleep lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is bad, it is bad, the buyer says; but when he is gone his way, then he boasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is gold and a multitude of precious stones, but the lips of wisdom are a precious vessel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him that is surety for a strange woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bread of deceit is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every thought must be ordered by counsel, and with intelligence war is made.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets; therefore meddle not with him that flatters with his lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever curses his father or his mother, his fire shall be put out in obscure darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning, but the end thereof shall not be blessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Say not thou, I will take vengeance, but wait on the LORD, and he shall save thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Double weights are an abomination unto the LORD, and a false balance is not good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Man’s steps are of the LORD; how can a man then understand his own way?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a snare unto man to devour that which is holy and afterward to reconsider his vows.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wise king scatters the wicked and brings the wheel over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The spirit of man is the fire of the LORD, which searches the secrets of the inward parts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mercy and truth preserve the king, and his throne is upheld by mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: The glory of young men is their strength, and the beauty of old men is the gray head.
speaker: Narrator

text: The scars of past wounds are medicine for evil, and living reproof reaches the most secret places in the inward parts.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king’s heart is in the hand of the LORD, as the rivers of water, he turns it wherever he will.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes: but the LORD weighs the hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: To do righteousness and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
speaker: Narrator

text: A high look and a proud heart, which is the fire of the wicked, is sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness, but of every one that is too hasty, only to want.
speaker: Narrator

text: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue is a vanity tossed to and fro of those that seek death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The robbery of the wicked shall destroy them because they refuse to do judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: The way of the perverse man is crooked and strange, but as for the pure, his work is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soul of the wicked desires evil; his neighbour finds no favour in his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise, and by instructing the wise, he receives wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: The righteous man wisely considers the house of the wicked, how God overthrows the wicked for their evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever stops his ears at the cry of the poor, he also shall cry himself but shall not be heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: A gift in secret pacifies anger, and a bribe in the bosom strong wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is joy to the just to do judgment, but it shall be destruction to the workers of iniquity.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man that wanders out of the way of wisdom shall end up in the congregation of the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that loves pleasure shall be a poor man; he that loves wine and oil shall not be rich.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the transgressor for the upright.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is better to dwell in the wilderness than with a contentious and an angry woman.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise; but a foolish man spends it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that follows after righteousness and mercy shall find life, righteousness, and honour.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise man took the city of the mighty and cast down its strength in which it trusted.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever keeps his mouth and his tongue keeps his soul from troubles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who deals in proud wrath.
speaker: Narrator

text: The desire of the slothful kills him; for his hands refuse to labour.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is one who covets greedily all day long, but the righteous gives and keeps on giving.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination; how much more, when he brings it with lewdness?
speaker: Narrator

text: The false witness shall perish, but the man that hears shall stand fast in his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wicked man hardens his face, but as for the upright, he orders his ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no wisdom nor intelligence nor counsel against the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: The horse is prepared against the day of battle, but salvation is of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: A good reputation is rather to be chosen than great riches and good grace rather than silver and gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rich and poor meet together; the LORD is the maker of them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: A prudent man foresees the evil and hides himself, but the simple pass on and receive hurt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Riches and honour and life are the remuneration of humility and of the fear of the LORD.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse; he that keeps his soul shall be far from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Train up a child in the way he should go; even when he is old, he will not depart from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rich rules over the poor, and the borrower is slave to the lender.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that sows iniquity shall reap iniquity, and the rod of his anger shall fail.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that has a merciful eye shall be blessed, for he gives of his bread to the destitute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; strife and reproach shall cease.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that loves pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthrows the words of the transgressor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slothful man says, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit; he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child, but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that oppresses the poor to increase his riches and who gives to the rich shall surely come to want.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bow down thine ear and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is a delightful thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall be ordered together in thy lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have I not written unto thee three times in counsels and knowledge,
speaker: Narrator

text: that I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth, that thou mightest answer the words of truth to those that send unto thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither destroy the destitute in judgment:
speaker: Narrator

text: For the LORD will judge their cause and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not meddle with an angry man, and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
speaker: Narrator

text: Lest thou learn his ways and get a snare to thy soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be not thou one of them that strike hands or of them that are sureties for debts.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should they take away thy bed from under thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seest thou a man diligent in his work? He shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before obscure men.
speaker: Narrator

text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee;
speaker: Narrator

text: and put a knife to thy throat if thou art a man given to appetite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be desirous of his dainties; for they are deceitful food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not labour to be rich; cease from thine own wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon riches which are not? For they shall certainly make themselves wings; they shall fly away as an eagle toward heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not eat the bread of anyone who has an evil eye, neither desire his dainty foods;
speaker: Narrator

text: for as he thinks in his soul, so is he; Eat and drink, he shall say unto thee, but his heart is not with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Didst thou eat thy part? Thou shalt vomit it up and lose thy sweet words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not speak in the ears of a fool, for he will despise the prudence of thy words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not remove the old landmark, and do not enter into the inheritance of the fatherless:
speaker: Narrator

text: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall judge their cause against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Apply thine heart unto chastening and thine ears to the words of wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not withhold correction from the child; for if thou shall beat him with the rod, he shall not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt beat him with the rod and shalt deliver his soul from Sheol.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, if thy heart is wise, my heart shall also rejoice;
speaker: Narrator

text: my kidneys shall also rejoice when thy lips speak right things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not thy heart envy sinners, but persevere in the fear of the LORD all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: For surely there is an end, and thy hope shall not be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and straighten thy heart in the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be among those who are drunk with wine; nor among gluttonous eaters of food;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty, and drowsiness shall cause them to wear rags.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Buy the truth and sell it not, also wisdom and instruction and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice, and he that begets a wise child shall have joy with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bore thee shall rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a whore is a deep ditch and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
speaker: Narrator

text: She also lies in wait as for a prey and increases the transgressors among men.
speaker: Narrator

text: For who shall be the woe? for who shall be the woe? for who contention? for who quarrels? for who the wounds without cause? who shall have redness of eyes?
speaker: Narrator

text: For those that tarry long at the wine; those that go to seek mixed wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not look upon the wine when it is red, when it gives its colour in the cup, it goes down smoothly.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the last it bites like a serpent and stings like an adder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lies down in the midst of the sea or as he that sleeps at the rudder.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have stricken me, thou shalt say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not; when I shall awake, I will seek it yet again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be envious of evil men, neither desire to be with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For their heart studies robbery, and their lips speak evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through wisdom the house shall be built, and with intelligence it shall be established:
speaker: Narrator

text: And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and beautiful riches.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wise man is strong; and the man of understanding is a mighty man of valour.
speaker: Narrator

text: For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war, and in the multitude of counsellors there is saving health.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wisdom, is too high for a fool; he shall not open his mouth in the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that devises to do evil shall be called a man of evil designs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The thought of the foolish is sin, and the scorner is an abomination to men.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou art slack in the day of tribulation, thy strength shall be reduced.
speaker: Narrator

text: If thou forbear to deliver those that are drawn unto death and those that are ready to be slain,
speaker: Narrator

text: if thou should say, Behold, we knew it not; shall not he that weighs the hearts understand it? and he that keeps thy soul, does he not know it? and shall he not render to every man according to his works?
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, eat of the honey, because it is good, and of the honeycomb, which is sweet to thy taste:
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: if thou shalt find it, and in the end thy hope shall not be cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not lay in wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; do not spoil his resting place.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a just man falls seven times and rises up again, but the wicked shall fall into evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not rejoice when thy enemy falls, and do not let thy heart be glad when he stumbles
speaker: Narrator

text: lest the LORD see it and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not meddle with those who are evil, neither be envious of the wicked;
speaker: Narrator

text: for the evil man shall not come to a good end; the fire of the wicked shall be put out.
speaker: Narrator

text: My son, fear the LORD and the king, and do not meddle with those that are given to change,
speaker: Narrator

text: for their calamity shall rise suddenly; and the ruin of them both, who shall know it?
speaker: Narrator

text: These things also belong to the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text: He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous; him shall the peoples curse, nations shall abhor him:
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto those that rebuke him shall be delight, and a blessing of good shall come upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lips of the one that gives a right answer shall be kissed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Prepare thy work without and make it fit for thyself in thine inheritance, and afterwards thou shalt build thine house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be a false witness against thy neighbour, and do not flatter with thy lips.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not say, I will do unto him as he has done unto me; I will render to the man according to his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: I went by the field of the slothful and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding,
speaker: Narrator

text: and, behold, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered its face, and its stone wall was broken down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it and received chastening.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall thy poverty come as one that travels and thy want as an armed man.
speaker: Narrator
